Create a line from point (0.375, 0.0375) to point (0.45, 0.0375) 5. Create an arc with the starting point at (0.45, 0.0375), midpoint at (0.4902, 0.0241), ending at (0.525, 0) 6. prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.25, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. The sketch should have one face (face\\_1) with a closed loop (loop\\_1) containing 4 lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.125 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.125 * Sketch scale: 0.75 Part 2: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat base and a pointed top Create a new coordinate system for part 2, with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.25, 0.125] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. The sketch should have one face (face\\_1) with a closed loop (loop\\_1) containing 3 lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.375, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.375] * Line 3: Start Point [0.375, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor 0.375. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0625 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0625 * Sketch scale: 0.375 * Operation: Cut the material from the existing CAD model These instructions will help the junior CAD designer to generate accurate CAD models for parts 1 and 2. The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners, and the second part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat base and a pointed top. The dimensions of both parts are provided within the JSON, and the designer should strictly adhere to those measurements for precision.</description>
